newsitem.title: USA: Brandywine buys 2 office parks for $77.2mln.
newsitem.headline: Brandywine buys 2 office parks for $77.2mln.

text.p: Brandywine Realty Trust said Friday it bought two office parks with a total of 816,000 rentable square feet for $77.2 million.

The trust bought Green Hills Corporate Center in Reading, Pa., which consists of five office properties totaling 574,241 square feet and 147 acres of undeveloped land. Green Hills is 85 percent leased, the trust said.
Brandywine also bought Berwyn Park in Berwyn, Pa., which contains three office properties totaling 241,458 square feet and 12.5 acres of undeveloped land. Berwyn is 98 percent leased, the trust said.
